name: Heavenly Home Stay

reviews.text: We had a lovely time here. Very hospitable couple who run a friendly home. Lovely breakfast and helpful in answering all our questions. A little difficult to find the place and also a bit difficult to get around fort cochin at first but it didn't take us long. A 15 min walk from the homestay to the small town in fort cochin. Definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Fabulous for the price
Great homestay
reviews.text: I don't want to repeat any of the great (and true) comments of other customers, but I do want to point out that the price is extremely reasonable. They don't have their price on the website, but I did a bit of comparison with other homestays around the area and Heavenly has the lowest price (almost half of all the other ones!!)
Patrick and Mary were very helpful throughout our stay, and the location is fantastic. Will recommend to all our friends if they're ever visiting Cochin!
reviews.title: Delightful family with two beautiful, immaculately clean rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a room at Heavenly Homestay based on tripadvisor reviews and was not disappointed! Mary and Patrick are both very kind and helpful, always eager to give recommendations about things to do and willing to make reservations for kathakali performances/houseboat tours. Patrick even drove me to the clinic when I was having some health problems. Their daughters, Jeny and Jefy are also very sweet, and Jeny is a talented watercolorist! They cook delicious (and plentiful) breakfasts, with both traditional Keralan cuisine and eggs/toast and a never-ending supply of fresh fruit!
reviews.title: Delightful Homestay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their home is very centrally-located, about five minutes from the Chinese fishing nets and another 5 minutes to the main tourist areas/Princess and Berger streets. There are two rooms, both with spotless white-tiled floors, comfortable beds, clean bathrooms, and showers.
reviews.title: The best homestay in Kerala!

reviews.text: 24th / 25th March 2012. We stayed with Patrick and Mary for two days and like other travellers we hadn't experienced a home stay before and we couldn't have been more pleased. Our room had a separate entrance and was large, very clean and comfortable (and with A/C). Patrick and Mary really were wonderful hosts and they made us feel very much at home. Our taxi was waiting for us at the airport as planned and Patrick was waiting for us with breakfast.
reviews.title: Wonderful hosts and a wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got great advice on where to go and eat and they arranged a driver (guide) for 4 days for the next leg of our trip to Munnar. Mary also called two days after we left them to check we were ok and happy.
reviews.title: Excellent Fort Kochin Homestay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Heavenly and Mary and Patrick (and the girls) were wonderful hosts, the breakfasts were a delicious start to the day and their advice invaluable.
reviews.title: Hospitable, super-clean and the best breakfast in India!

reviews.text: If I ever return to Cochin for another holiday then I would most def stay with Mary and Patrick and I can't recommend them enough to other travellers.
reviews.title: Heavenly Homestay, a place where you are welcomed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I add to the glowing reports already listed?
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.text: This is an excellent choice as the large rooms are very clean with huge bathrooms and the nicest family as hosts. Patric and Mary arranged for our transportation from the airport at 3:30 AM and were there to greet us on our arrival, plus they were able to find solutions for our every need from transportation to restaurant recommendations to finding a Nikon photography supplier and a notary public. We had booked both rooms for our stay and both are excellent. The food is fantastic with different breakfast dishes every day of our 8 day stay. As everyone has said, the location is great and we walked to everywhere in Fort Kochi. Absolutely the best homestay we have seen in two different visits to India.
reviews.title: Heaven away from home

reviews.text: Wonderful homestay. Lovely people and possibly the cleanest room I've ever stayed in in India. Very accommodating to our needs which you wouldn't get in a hotel, for instance we had to get up very early 1 morning for our flight and Mary obliged by getting up at 6am to cook our breakfast. The downstairs room is perfectly private despite other comments and has separate access at the back so you don't have to go through the main house. Would strongly recommend this place for people that want a taste of the real Cochin in a very friendly neighbourhood as opposed to being stuck in an overpriced hotel surrounded by tourist shops.
reviews.title: Great experience, good price, very clean.
Five-star accommodation in a home
reviews.text: We chose Heavenly Homestay because of its name and heavenly it turned out to be. A spotless and spacious room with its own terrace and wonderfully comfortable beds. The bathroom sparkled and has the most fascinating mirror. And air-conditioning too. All within easy walking distance of attractions such as the Chinese fishing nets, the ferries, the Kathakali Theatre and Oceanus Restaurant.

All this would have been good value for the price but what made Heavenly Homestay really special was our hosts, Mary and Patric. They couldn't do enough for us. From the first-rate Keralan breakfast to booking us on tours and giving us clear directions to an empty beach on Vypeen Island. There is an excellent guide to Kochi in the room and we had some wifi too. Patric learnt a thing or two when he worked at the Casa Nova Hotel and our stay was one of the highlights of our trip to India.
reviews.title: Fantastic homestay in Fort Kochi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful stay in with Patrick, Mary and their family in their homestay. The room was lovely with a separate entrance and was very clean. Both Patrick and Mary were fantastic hosts and made us feel very welcome. We also very much enjoyed the breakfasts prepared for us each day. A lovely homestay which I would highly recommend to people travelling to Fort Kochi.
reviews.title: Clean, cool, modern rooms in a quiet part of Kochi.

reviews.text: If 10 stars were available from Trip Advisor, then Heavenly Homestay in Fort Cochin, Kerala would get all 10 of them!
reviews.title: 10 stars!

reviews.text: I was travelling alone for almost 6 weeks in India and Nepal. No mean feat for an aging 46 year old female! I had travelled a lot around the USA and Europe, both as a student (many moons ago) alone, and with my children when married.
reviews.title: an familial and very plesant home stay in fort kochi
Amazing breakfast and great hosts!
reviews.text: India had me beat for a while. The culture shock just cant be put into words.

reviews.title: Sweet family, comfortable room, amazing breakfast
reviews.text: But if you get to Kerala then do your upmost to stay at Heavenly Homestay. It will soften the blow if the culture shock. The owners speak good english and the room I stayed in (upstairs) beats any 5 star luxury hotel. It's sparkling clean, AC, no bugs or wires sticking out of the wall (as has happened in previous hotels I stayed in in India....)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast provided was enough to set you up for the day and everyday different.
reviews.title: The most amazing hosts...

aka: Heavenly Home Stay Kochi (Cochin), India - Kerala
description: Located near the INS Dronacharya North Gate and close to the Meckanzy Garden Road, Heavenly Homestay is easily accessible from Cochin. The nearest railway station is Ernakulam Junction and the nearest airport is at Nedumbaserry. We have pick-up and drop for tourists and can arrange taxis to take you around the city. Heavenly Homestay is owned by K.B. Patrick and his family. We have one AC room (double bed) with attached bathrooms and hot water. They come with free internet in the rooms. We also have laundry service, taxi and two-wheeler facility and currency exchange. We are a small family and love to entertain guests. We can arrange for trips in the city, especially in Fort Cochin and around.
